column2: Description
column4: Instructions

column2: Focuses on being present in the moment and non-judgmentally observing your thoughts and surroundings.
column4: Sit in a comfortable position with your eyes closed and focus on your breath. When your mind wanders, gently bring your attention back to your breath.

column2: Uses a mantra to help quiet the mind and achieve a deep state of relaxation.
column4: Sit in a comfortable position with your eyes closed and repeat a mantra silently to yourself. Allow your mind to become absorbed in the mantra.

column2: Involves generating feelings of love and compassion towards oneself and others.
column4: Sit in a comfortable position with your eyes closed and repeat phrases of loving-kindness to yourself and others.

column2: Involves systematically bringing attention to different parts of the body, noticing sensations and relaxing tension.
column4: Lie down or sit in a comfortable position with your eyes closed. Focus on each part of your body starting from your toes and working your way up to the top of your head.

column2: Involves observing the breath and bodily sensations to gain insight into the nature of reality.
column4: Sit in a comfortable position with your eyes closed and observe your breath and bodily sensations without judgement.

column2: Involves sitting in silence and focusing on the breath, often with the support of a teacher or group.
column4: Sit in a comfortable position with your eyes half-closed and focus on your breath. Follow the instructions of your teacher.

column2: Involves focusing on each of the body's energy centers to balance and align them.
column4: Sit in a comfortable position with your eyes closed and focus on each chakra, starting from the base of your spine and working your way up to the crown of your head.

column2: Involves repeating a word or phrase to focus the mind and achieve a calm state.
column4: Sit in a comfortable position with your eyes closed and repeat a mantra silently to yourself. Allow your mind to become absorbed in the mantra.

column2: Involves counting each breath to maintain focus and concentration.
column4: Sit in a comfortable position with your eyes closed and count each inhale and exhale up to 10. Start over at 1 if you get distracted.

column2: Involves walking slowly and mindfully, focusing on each step and the sensations in the body.
column4: Find a quiet place to walk slowly. Focus on each step, the sensations in your feet and legs, and the environment around you.

column2: Involves creating a mental image or scenario to promote relaxation and positive emotions.
column4: Sit in a comfortable position with your eyes closed and visualize a peaceful scene or positive outcome. Engage all your senses in the visualization.

column2: Involves lying down and systematically relaxing different parts of the body to achieve a deep state of relaxation.
column4: Lie down in a comfortable position and follow the instructions of the teacher as they guide you through relaxation of each part of the body.

column2: Involves focusing on a particular sound or a series of sounds to promote relaxation.
column4: Sit in a comfortable position with your eyes closed and focus on a particular sound, such as chanting, a gong, or a singing bowl.

column2: Involves combining movement, breath, and visualization to improve physical and mental health.
column4: Follow the movements and breathing exercises of a Qi Gong teacher or video, and visualize the flow of energy in your body.

column2: Involves combining breathwork, movement, and mantra to awaken the energy at the base of the spine and raise it up through the chakras.
column4: Follow the instructions of a Kundalini teacher or video, combining breathwork, movement, and mantra.

column2: Involves sitting in silence and observing the mind without judgment.
column4: Sit in a comfortable position with your eyes closed and observe your thoughts and sensations without getting caught up in them.

column2: Involves observing one's thoughts and feelings without judgment and allowing them to come and go.
column4: Sit in a comfortable position with your eyes closed and observe your thoughts and feelings without trying to change or control them.

column2: Involves focusing on a specific object or sound to maintain concentration and develop awareness.
column4: Sit in a comfortable position with your eyes closed and focus on a specific object or sound, such as a candle flame or the sound of a bell.

column2: Involves cultivating feelings of loving-kindness and compassion towards oneself and others.
column4: Sit in a comfortable position with your eyes closed and repeat phrases of loving-kindness to yourself and others.

column2: Involves focusing on the sensations in the body to develop awareness and relaxation.

column4: Sit in a comfortable position with your eyes closed and visualize yourself and others experiencing happiness and freedom from suffering.
